p: Temperature has a significant effect on the distribution and growth of the two species (Pinke et al., 2011; Qin et al., 2014; Storkey et al., 2014). Ambrosia artemisiifolia and A. trifida have become widespread in temperate regions (Bassett & Crompton, 1975; Essl et al., 2015; Montagnani et al., 2017). Seeds of the two species require prolonged chilling to break dormancy (Bazzaz, 1979; Davis, 1930; Essl et al., 2015; Shrestha et al., 1999). Following seedling emergence, the rate of vegetative growth depends on temperature, but development occurs over a wide thermal range (Deen et al., 1998).
